node.title: 'We have serious concerns': US considers diplomatic boycott of Beijing Olympics
node.alt: President Joe Biden speaks during a virtual COVID-19 summit
node.description: United StateÂ activists and members of Congress from both parties are pressing the Biden administration to boycott the Beijing Winter Olympics over alleged human rights violations against Muslim minorities.
node.content:
["The United States is considering a diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Olympics, President Joe Biden confirmed \u2014\u00a0a move aimed at protesting China's human rights record and what Washington says is genocide against minority Muslims.", "\"[It's] something we're considering,\" Mr Biden said.\u00a0", "A diplomatic boycott would mean US officials would not attend the opening of the Beijing Winter Olympics in February.", "Such a decision not to send diplomats would be a rebuke of Chinese President Xi Jinping, just days after Mr Xi and Mr Biden worked to ease tensions in a virtual summit.\u00a0", "Activists and members of Congress from both parties have been pressing the Biden administration to diplomatically boycott the event.", "White House spokesperson Jen Psaki said US consideration of a diplomatic boycott of the Winter Olympics was driven by concerns about human rights practices in Xinjiang province.", "\"Certainly there [is]\u00a0a range of factors as we look at what our presence would be,\" she said, while declining to provide a timeline for a decision.", "\"I want to leave the President the space to make decisions.\"\u00a0", "Sources close to the administration said\u00a0there was a growing consensus within the White House that it should keep US officials away from the Winter Olympics.", "Last week, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Washington was talking to countries around the world about \"how they're thinking about participation\", but left a deadline for a decision unclear.", "In October, a\u00a0bipartisan group of senators proposed an amendment to an annual defence policy bill that would prohibit the US\u00a0State Department from spending federal funds to \"support or facilitate\" the attendance of US\u00a0government employees at the Games.", "", "
A diplomatic boycott means US officials would not attend the opening of the Beijing Winter Olympics.\u00a0(Reuters: Thomas Peter)
", "House Speaker\u00a0Nancy Pelosi, a Democrat,\u00a0has also called for a diplomatic boycott, saying global leaders who attend would lose their moral authority.", "Some Republican lawmakers have been calling for a complete boycott of the Olympics.", "Arkansas Senator Tom Cotton said a diplomatic boycott of what he called the \"genocide Olympics\" would be \"too little, too late\" and said no US athletes, officials\u00a0or corporate sponsors should take part.", "Nikki Haley, a Republican and former US ambassador to the United Nations, also had called for a complete boycott, saying attending would send a message that America was willing to turn a blind eye to genocide.", "Reuters"]
